Abstract: Next-generation ion mobility experiments have revolutionized the field of mass spectrometry by enabling the depth of analyses of biomolecules. By combining advanced ion mobility techniques with multidimensional analysis, researchers can now elucidate the complex structures of biomolecules with unprecedented precision. This study demonstrates the application of next-generation ion mobility experiments in the structural elucidation of biomolecules, highlighting the potential for molecular identification and characterization. The results show that ion mobility mass spectrometry can provide detailed information on the conformational properties of biomolecules, facilitating the development of novel analytical strategies for the identification and structural elucidation of biomolecules.
